publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-5326 Tommy Sheridan: Shelter - Homeless Children at Christmas—That the Parliament notes with concern Shelter Scotland’s estimate that almost 5,000 children will be in temporary accommodation this Christmas and that, despite a three-year-old Scottish Executive pledge, reported in the Daily Record, that there would be no homeless children in bed and breakfast hotels at Christmas, there are still councils using unsuitable accommodation for children at this time of year. Supported by: Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Roseanna Cunningham*, Campbell Martin*

S2M-5326 Tommy Sheridan: Shelter - Homeless Children at Christmas—That the Parliament notes with concern Shelter Scotland’s estimate that almost 5,000 children will be in temporary accommodation this Christmas and that, despite a three-year-old Scottish Executive pledge, reported in the Daily Record, that there would be no homeless children in bed and breakfast hotels at Christmas, there are still councils using unsuitable accommodation for children at this time of year. Supported by: Ms Rosemary Byrne, Roseanna Cunningham, Campbell Martin, Tricia Marwick*, Murray Tosh*
S2M-5326 Shelter - Homeless Children at Christmas (lodged on 14 December 2006) John Swinburne*, Mark Ballard*, Donald Gorrie*, Mr Adam Ingram*
S2M-5326 Shelter - Homeless Children at Christmas (lodged on 14 December 2006) Mr Stewart Maxwell*, Dr Jean Turner*

S2M-5326 Tommy Sheridan: Shelter - Homeless Children at Christmas—That the Parliament notes with concern Shelter Scotland’s estimate that almost 5,000 children will be in temporary accommodation this Christmas and that, despite a three-year-old Scottish Executive pledge, reported in the Daily Record, that there would be no homeless children in bed and breakfast hotels at Christmas, there are still councils using unsuitable accommodation for children at this time of year. Supported by: Ms Rosemary Byrne, Roseanna Cunningham, Campbell Martin, Tricia Marwick, Murray Tosh, John Swinburne, Mark Ballard, Donald Gorrie, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Stewart Maxwell, Dr Jean Turner
